meanings.definition: To add or attach something to a larger or more important thing.
meanings.sent1: She enjoys subjoining colorful stickers to her notebook.
meanings.sent2: The mechanic is subjoining the new part to the engine.
meanings.sent3: The chef subjoining extra cheese to the pizza made it even more delicious.
meanings.sent4: His dedication to subjoining new ideas to the project was like adding fuel to a fire.
meanings.sent5: The artist's skillful subjoining of different colors created a beautiful painting.

meanings.definition: To join or unite something to something else.
meanings.sent1: The teacher is subjoining the two puzzle pieces together.
meanings.sent2: He subjoining the two ropes to make a longer one.
meanings.sent3: The kids subjoining their toys to create a giant robot was quite a sight.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness acts as a glue, subjoining people from different backgrounds.
meanings.sent5: The magician's trick involved subjoining two separate rings into one.
